Description: Mould-made pottery lamp with an angled nozzle, decorated on the discus with a grasshopper feeding. The shoulder is decorated with ovules. The lamp stands on a raised base impressed with monogram on the base (the large raised point below it is from an air bubble in the mould, and not a mouldmark). Orange clay, covered with a red slip. Plaster mould.
Bibliographic references: Lamp / Catalogue of the Lamps in the British Museum (1954)
Walters 1914 / Catalogue of Greek and Roman Lamps in the British Museum (604)
Cahn-Klaiber 1977 / Die antiken Tonlampen der Archäologischen Instituts der Universität Tübingen (p.194)
Acquisition name: Purchased from: Rev Greville John Chester
